snippet: An American man who a militant group said detonated 16 tons of explosives was remembered in the Florida subdivision where he grew up for his love of basketball.
abstract: Neighbors of American suicide bomber Moner Mohammad Abusalha, who grew up in suburban Florida, remember his love of basketball; militant group Nusra Front has said that Abusalha detonated 16 tons of explosives at mountaintop restaurant in Syria.

byline.original: By FRANCES ROBLES and EMMA G. FITZSIMMONS
byline.contributor: Frances Robles reported from Vero Beach, and Emma G. Fitzsimmons from New York. Sheelagh McNeill contributed research. Wendy Thompson contributed reporting from Orlando, Fla., and Michael S. Schmidt from Washington.

lead_paragraph: An American man who a militant group said detonated 16 tons of explosives was remembered in the Florida subdivision where he grew up for his love of basketball.

headline.main: Before Syrian Suicide Blast, a Quiet Life in the Suburbs
headline.print_headline: Before Syrian Suicide Blast, a Quiet Life in the Suburbs
